revised_title: The Earth's Interior Shells: A Comparison with Enstatite Chondrite Meteorites
tldr: The author suggests that the Earth's core and lower mantle are chemically similar to the two main components of enstatite chondrite meteorites. This is supported by mass ratio comparisons. The Earth's interior shells are inferred to be made up of silicate minerals and sulfur-based iron alloys, similar to the components of enstatite chondrites. This theory helps explain the Earth's density differences and the composition of its interior shells.
